userContext.situation: They are evaluating liquid filling machines for a production line - either setting up new filling operations or upgrading existing equipment. They need to understand which type of filling machine matches their specific liquid product.
userContext.currentState: They know they need a liquid filling machine but are confused by the variety of types (gravity, piston, pump, overflow, etc.). They are unsure which technology is best for their specific liquid product characteristics (viscosity, particulates, foaming, etc.).
userContext.desiredState: After reading, they want a clear understanding of each filling machine type, when to use it, and confidence to select or shortlist the right type for their product.

searchIntent.coreQuestion: Which type of liquid filling machine is best suited for my specific product characteristics and production requirements?
implicitQuestions: What are the main types of liquid filling machines and how do they differ?
How does liquid viscosity affect filling machine selection?
What filling accuracy can I expect from different machine types?
How do I match filling machine speed to my production volume needs?
What are the cost differences between filling machine types?
searchIntent.successCriteria: Reader can identify 2-3 suitable filling machine types for their specific liquid product and confidently proceed to vendor evaluation.

goldenInsights.insight: Piston systems see roughly 18% less wasted product compared to traditional pump fillers
Nozzle outer diameter should be at least 4-6mm smaller than bottle opening to allow air escape
Premium equipment pays back within 12-18 months through material savings alone
A machine saving 3-5% material waste annually pays for itself in under 2 years

differentiation.primaryDifferentiator: Specific accuracy, speed, and ROI data that competitors completely lack - enabling real decision-making rather than generic descriptions

irreplicableInsights.insight: Servo-driven piston accuracy +/-0.25% vs peristaltic pump 1-2%
11 common selection mistakes checklist with specific criteria
Viscosity chart with cP values matched to machine recommendations
Machine construction can inadvertently change viscosity through extra pipes/elbows

avoidList: Generic machine type descriptions without specifications
Listing types without explaining when to use each
No decision framework or selection criteria
No data on accuracy, speed, or cost

coverage: Limited case studies with specific company examples

research.coreThesis: The right liquid filling machine depends on three factors: your product's viscosity, your accuracy requirements, and your production volume - not marketing claims or brand reputation.

emphasize: ROI data (18% waste reduction, 12-18 month payback)
differentiateWith: Include accuracy tolerances competitors lack: Piston +/-0.25% vs Pump 1-2%
Provide viscosity chart with cP values and machine recommendations
Add ROI justification data for equipment investment decisions
Create clear decision framework based on product characteristics
